definition: lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to come forth in large numbers
the younger generation/those who come after

sentences.english: They are farmers whose forefathers lived on this land.
sentences.chinese: 祖辈辈都住居在这片土地上的农民。

sentences.english: This will no longer be your grandparents’ World Bank.
sentences.chinese: 这将不再是祖父辈的世界银行。

sentences.english: The seniority system is another factor that leads to union militancy .
sentences.chinese: 排资论辈制度也是导致工会好斗争的另一因素。

sentences.english: Zenani was one of Mr Mandela's nine great-grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 泽娜尼是曼德拉九个曾孙辈后代中的一个。

sentences.english: Should promotion be through merit or seniority?
sentences.chinese: 晋升是看业绩还是排资论辈？

sentences.english: Our grandfathers ancestored some of the well-known families in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖父辈是北京几家望族的祖先。

sentences.english: What need now is the security of a happy home.
sentences.chinese: 我现咱需要的是一个幸福家庭所给澡的辈全感。

sentences.english: United Kingdom consists of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 陋合王国陨大不列掂和辈爱尔兰组成。

definition: of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
seniority in the family or clan/position in the family hierarchy
(of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
offspring/future generations/younger generation of a family/junior members of a group
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
the younger generation/those who come after
